A discourse upon this saying: the spirit of the nation is not yet to be trusted with liberty; lest it introduce monarchy, or invade the liberty of conscience. Harrington, James, 1611-1677.
[2], 14 p.
printed by J.C. for Henry Fletcher, at the three Gilt Cups in Paul's Church-yard, London : [1659]
Signed and dated: Ja. Harrington. May 16. MDCLIX. Annotation on Thomason copy: "May 17th 1659"; "1659". Reproduction of the original in the British Library and the Harvard library.
=======
